author: jkf
msg: In ant 1.7 the security manager will, unless explicitly created to allow
System.exit veto a System.exit. This allows ant to continue its run when
a java program started via the java tasks in nonforked mode without
failonerror set calls System.exit. For java tasks in forked mode nothing
changes. For java tasks with failonerror set this was already the existing

author: bodewig
msg: Small refactoring to allow a less memory consuming "streaming mode"

author: jkf
msg: Restored javadoc in the original format.

author: jkf
msg: FTP list command could crash with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.
